p: The last decades have seen the lack of new therapeutic drug developments against infectious diseases. Thus, emergence of several resistances and new epidemics are more and more noticed all over the world. These public health concerns have led to (re)evaluating traditional medical practices in order to highlight new molecules or new mechanisms of action. Plants like Morus spp., jackfruit ( Artocarpus heterophyllus), coffea, and others are more and more studied in this context. Their potential activity against viral infections have been previously described in several studies [ 1, 2, 3, 4].
